content.description: Â© Vanni Archive / Art Resource, NY
content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

Correctly attribute the work shown to the cultural tradition in which it was created.

Using specific visual evidence, justify your attribution by describing at least two relevant similarities between the work shown and other work from the same tradition.

Using at least two examples of specific evidence, explain how the design of the work was influenced by its specific function and/or religious context.

unit.text: 8: South, East, and Southeast Asia, 300 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 8.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in South, East, and Southeast Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
